channel.title: Shreyas Korad — Writing
channel.description: Articles and insights on learning design, gamification, and L&D strategy.

item.title: Cross-functional learning patterns that work across departments
item.description: A practical operating model for cross-functional learning patterns that work across departments with measurable checkpoints, governance discipline, and iteration rules that prevent

item.title: Measurement doesn't have to be painful for learning programs
item.description: A practical operating model for measurement doesn't have to be painful for learning programs with measurable checkpoints, governance discipline, and iteration rules that prevent lo

item.title: Practical AI Feedback Loops for Learning Managers
item.description: Managers want to support employee growth but often lack time and tools for meaningful feedback.

item.title: Measuring L&D impact: How to tie learning to business outcomes
item.description: Effective learning programs fail without clear metrics. Many organizations track course completion rates or satisfaction scores that don't actually drive business outcomes. Real impact measurement starts by asking what decision improvement you want to enable.

item.title: Use learning experiments to surface patterns not isolated wins
item.description: Extract systematic insights from learning experiments instead of treating each win as an isolated event.

item.title: Turn project feedback into actionable learning cycles
item.description: Connect project feedback to learning cycles that surface insights and drive behavior change.

item.title: Create micro-learning moments in daily team standups
item.description: Turn recurring daily meetings into deliberate learning opportunities with focused questions and reflection triggers.

item.title: Use learning data to surface team blind spots not just completion metrics
item.description: Shift from vanity metrics to blindness detection by connecting learning data with team performance patterns.

item.title: Data-Informed Gamification Beyond Leaderboards
item.description: Data-informed gamification uses analytics to identify which mechanics drive behavior change and measurable learning transfer. Instead of arbitrary leaderboards, successful programs track specific actions that align with business outcomes.

item.title: Design learning rhythms that work across time zones and functions
item.description: Cross-functional teams distributed across time zones need learning rhythms that work for everyone. Learn practical approaches to maintaining consistent learning across functions and locations.

item.title: Use AI to surface onboarding decision patterns for first-year hires
item.description: First-year hires drown in decisions every week. AI tools can surface patterns from these decisions to improve outcomes and reduce mistakes.

item.title: Design prompts that improve decisions under project pressure
item.description: Real-time AI support becomes judgment scaffolding when prompts surface precedents and frameworks. Learn three patterns for designing prompts that improve decisions under pressure.

item.title: How to design prompts that improve decisions under project pressure
item.description: Without pressure replication and decision-quality framing, learners tune out or apply superficial fixes.

item.title: How Managers Use Weekly One-On-Ones for Learning Conversations
item.description: Weekly one-on-ones become learning moments when managers use specific coaching questions instead of just status updates.

item.title: Real-time AI coaching for LxD professionals
item.description: L&D professionals make countless design decisions every day. Real-time AI coaching can help them make better decisions faster.

item.title: How Learning Analytics Improves Engagement and Retention
item.description: Pre-launch analytics transforms outcomes by identifying friction points before full rollout.

item.title: Design learning programs that tie to business metrics
item.description: A practical operating model for design learning programs that tie to business metrics with measurable checkpoints, governance rules, and iteration discipline that prevents low-sign

item.title: How AI can turn everyday learning habits into measurable growth
item.description: A practical operating model for how ai can turn everyday learning habits into measurable growth with measurable checkpoints, governance rules, and iteration discipline that prevent

item.title: Using AI to surface learning insights from everyday team conversations
item.description: A practical operating model for using ai to surface learning insights from everyday team conversations with measurable checkpoints, governance rules, and iteration discipline that

item.title: AI-native L&D workflows for small teams
item.description: A practical operating model for ai-native l&d workflows for small teams with measurable checkpoints, governance rules, and iteration discipline that prevents low-signal content fro

item.title: Design decision-quality training that builds practical judgment instead of compliance
item.description: Teams often default to compliance-focused training when they need to improve decision quality. One company redesigned their approach to build judgment instead.

item.title: Build feedback rituals that convert learning into visible team behavior
item.description: Teams often treat feedback as a one-time event that fades quickly. Effective rituals turn learning into ongoing behavior changes.

item.title: Create L&D reviews that focus on behavior shifts not completion dashboards
item.description: Shifting L&D reviews from completion dashboards to behavior-focused conversations builds real impact.

item.title: Create learning opportunities that build judgment through real decisions
item.description: Create learning opportunities that build judgment through real decisions, not simulated scenarios.

item.title: Build learning culture that supports judgment over compliance
item.description: Build learning culture that supports judgment over compliance to create environments where teams experiment and learn.

item.title: Improve judgment without adding course fatigue
item.description: Practice judgment in actual work contexts to build skills without adding course fatigue.

item.title: Design learning prompts that improve decisions during real project pressure
item.description: A practical operating model for design learning prompts that improve decisions during real project pressure with measurable checkpoints, governance rules, and iteration discipline

item.title: Coach managers to run better learning conversations in weekly ones
item.description: Coach managers to run better learning conversations in weekly ones that surface learning and make adjustments faster.

item.title: Help cross functional teams learn faster through shared project retrospectives
item.description: A practical operating model for help cross functional teams learn faster through shared project retrospectives with measurable checkpoints, governance rules, and iteration discipli

item.title: Design onboarding that builds role judgment instead of checklist compliance
item.description: Teach decision making not just knowledge to help employees make better judgments on the job.

item.title: Design data-informed learning programs that show business impact
item.description: Use data to surface where learning transfers and where it doesn't to measure and improve learning transfer.

item.title: Use reflective debriefs after projects to strengthen learning transfer
item.description: Projects often end without intentional reflection. One company built reflective debriefs into their project lifecycle to strengthen learning transfer.

item.title: Design manager enablement that links coaching actions to team capability growth
item.description: A simple framework lets design managers turn coaching conversations into data‑driven capability improvements.

item.title: Micro-learning for daily decision making
item.description: Micro-learning for daily decision making delivers context-aware support exactly when managers face a decision, improving outcomes without overwhelming their schedules.

item.title: Make learning evidence useful for business reviews without heavy reporting overhead
item.description: Learn how to streamline learning evidence for clear business reviews without extra reporting work.

item.title: Design learning for retention, not just compliance
item.description: Retention beats compliance when you create meaningful reasons for people to engage repeatedly.

item.title: Design gamification that actually improves performance
item.description: Meaningful gamification aligns incentives with real performance and creates sustainable behavior change.

item.title: Practical AI tools for learning designers
item.description: Human-centered AI works best when humans make the final decisions about learning quality and relevance.

item.title: Use data-informed learning decisions, not assumptions
item.description: Data beats intuition when you use it to inform decisions, not justify them. Small, consistent data-informed changes compound faster than big assumptions.

item.title: Build a practical LxD workflow for small teams shipping weekly
item.description: A practical operating model for build a practical lxd workflow for small teams shipping weekly with measurable checkpoints, governance rules, and iteration discipline that prevents

item.title: Design learning for decision quality not completion rates
item.description: Learning design often traps us in a completion game. We track how many courses learners finish instead of how well they apply what they learned.

item.title: Design without losing human judgment
item.description: AI tools keep appearing faster than anyone can integrate them into learning design.

item.title: Design gamification for decision quality, not points
item.description: Gamification works when mechanics reinforce better decisions and measurable capability growth, not when they only reward participation.

item.title: AI feedback works only when it supports human coaching
item.description: AI feedback creates value when it amplifies human coaching and improves real decisions, not when it just increases message volume.

item.title: Game-based learning should change behavior, not just engagement
item.description: Game-based learning is useful only when it changes decisions and behavior in real work, not when it just raises participation.

item.title: The Object Without Attachment
item.description: Humans are wired to bond with things we work through, not just finish. When AI compresses effort, you get the result without the emotional imprint that normally makes it feel yours.

item.title: Where we go from here
item.description: Where we go from here discusses data‑backed strategies for embedding learning in daily workflows, boosting performance and judgment.

item.title: If everyone is losing jobs, who pays for AI infrastructure?
item.description: If everyone is losing jobs, who pays for AI infrastructure? It is funded by concentrated capital and by customers, and the risk is who gets left out.

item.title: Accelerando and the future of L&D
item.description: When AI is embedded in workflows, performance support is dead and L&D shifts to shaping how work gets done.

item.title: AI Hype vs Adoption
item.description: Everything around AI is overhyped for retention. But how much is actually getting adopted into daily workflows?

item.title: The Art vs Craft of Building with Code
item.description: Tools make implementation easier, but they don't solve the harder problem of designing systems that actually work.

item.title: Publishing Without the WordPress Headache
item.description: I keep coming back to a simple question: can I get my ideas onto my website without the WordPress circus?

item.title: The Human Edge
item.description: Why human context windows still matter, even as AI gets faster and cheaper with smaller prompts.

item.title: Skills in L&D
item.description: We're attracted to skills systems without understanding maintenance. The focus should be embedding skills in AI systems first.
